metadata.title: CVE-2024-48916 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Authentication bypass in CEPH RadosGW

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-48916` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-base - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-common - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-exporter - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-fuse - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-grafana-dashboards - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mds - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mgr - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mgr-k8sevents - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mgr-modules-core - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mgr-rook - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
ceph-mon - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1

ceph-resource-agents - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1

cephfs-mirror - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1

crimson-osd - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
libcephfs-java - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
libcephfs-jni - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
libcephfs2 - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
librados2 - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
libradosstriper1 - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
librbd1 - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
librgw2 - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
libsqlite3-mod-ceph - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
python3-ceph - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
python3-ceph-argparse - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1

rbd-nbd - 19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '19.2.0-0ubuntu2.1').
